intro: Pneumonanthe campanulata, commonly known as the bluebell of the genus Pneumonanthe, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers, which are blue or violet in color, bloom in early spring and attract various pollinators.
